a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif

text.tspan: Human Development Index vs. mean male height, 1996
The Human Development Index (HDI) is a summary measure of key dimensions of human development: a long
and healthy life, being knowledgeable, and a decent standard of living. It is shown against mean male height in
Mean male height by year of birth (centimeters)
Data source: UNDP, Human Development Report (2024); NCD RisC, Human Height (2017)
